messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] Re: Laura Intro/Oklahoma
messages.msgSnippet: ... We re not trying to fill in a map, though.  If you feel that organizing a group would help your kids or people you know in your area, and if you want to go
messages.messageBody:
On Feb 22, 2006, at 11:59 AM, homeschoolcrew6 wrote:

> was surprised that there were no groups listed from Canada. I wonder
> if I should bite the old bullet and start one...hmmmm. Do you know of
> any unschooling groups in Canada, more specifically Ontario?


We're not trying to fill in a map, though. If you feel that
organizing a group would help your kids or people you know in your
area, and if you want to go to the trouble to create and maintain a
group, then do it for that reason. It's okay with that webpage if
there's not an Ontario listing. <g>

Sandra

messages.subject: Re:Laura Intro/Oklahoma
messages.msgSnippet: Thank you Sandra, I appreciate it! I do want to tell you also, that I have been reading your site off and on for the last few years, you have offered so much
messages.messageBody:
Thank you Sandra, I appreciate it! I do want to tell you also, that I have been reading your site off and on for the last few years, you have offered so much help to me. Thank you for doing all you do.
Laura

I added your group here:
http://sandradodd.com/local

Hey Sandra
I was surprised that there were no groups listed from Canada. I wonder
if I should bite the old bullet and start one...hmmmm. Do you know of
any unschooling groups in Canada, more specifically Ontario?

Thanks

messages.subject: Laura Intro/Oklahoma
messages.msgSnippet: Hi All, I am Laura. I am an unschooler. I have been married 11 years as of this last saturday! We live in Oklahoma City. I am originally from Oklahoma, but
messages.messageBody:
Hi All,

I am Laura. I am an unschooler. I have been married 11 years as of
this last saturday! We live in Oklahoma City. I am originally from
Oklahoma, but just got home in December from a two year move in the
Houston, TX area. I have been unschooling since the beginning,
although I didn't realize it until about 4 years ago. I have 3 kids.
I have a boy 8, girl 5, and a baby girl 1. I am so glad to be apart
of this group. I have been posting my intro to several groups as I
have been on *no mail* for quite some time. I have loved reading the
posts recently. I especially liked the ones about what unschooling
looks like this minute.

A friend of mine and I just started a new yahoo group tonight for
christian unschoolers in the OKC area. If any of you are here in
Oklahoma, please come and join us too on a local level! We are
wanting to get together with people that are in our area as well as
online!

I look forward to being a part of this group!

http://groups.yahoo.com/group/unschoolingchristiansinokcmetro

Blessings,.· ´¨¨)) -:¦:-
